17.label: Confirmation
17.description:
We, the above listed agree to take all necessary care and precautions with regards to the above-mentioned Dog for the duration of his or her life, effective at the date nominated below. I also agree to pay any fines/fees etc incurred whilst the dog is in my custody. This includes any breaches of the relevant local council regulations or laws (such as the dog being found "at large"), the dog being impounded or being injured.

Please be aware that we cannot give refunds simply because you change your mind. In line with DELWP regulations, a 75% refund will be given within the first 72 hours. Refunds after 72 hours will be given at our discretion.

Please note: Homeless Hounds Animal Rescue is here to support you and your Dog. Please contact us if you need help or advice. We ask that you contact us if you can no longer keep him or her.

settings.form_title: Surrender Form for Dogs and Cats
settings.form_desc: Note: Surrendering a pet is usually only available to Victorian residents, however, if you are located interstate and able to transport your pet, we may be able to help.

2.subject: Thanks for getting in touch.
2.message:
Hi {field_id="7"},

Thanks for submitting this Surrender form for your pet. A member of our volunteer team will be in touch with you in 1-2 business days, or ASAP.

We understand that surrendering a pet isn’t easy and that this decision must have been hard for you and your family. We seek to make the process as easy as possible for you and your pet. 

Rescue is incredibly busy and we are currently seeing an unprecedented number of dogs and cats in need. This, coupled with fewer available volunteers and opportunities to fundraise means that we often do not have space in foster homes. 

**We do, however, want to help you responsibly rehome your animal and have a good option for you to consider - this is our foster to surrender program.**

In the foster-to-surrender program, the surrendering-owner keeps their pet until a suitable adopter is found. We will work with you to assess your animals specific needs, likes, dislikes and training considerations. We will then advertise your pet, screen potential adopters and work together to select the best home for your pet. 

Homeless Hounds support the adopters to settle the animal in successfully and address any training or medical needs. We charge an adoption fee to the new adopters to cover these costs, so there is no charge to you (however, we will happily accept donations!)

The foster-to-surrender program is a great option for surrendering owners and pets. Not only does it ensure that you get to be a part of the selection process, it also means that your pet does not have to be put through the stress of an extra move before being settled in their new home. 

This is often the fastest and most successful way to get your pet rehomed safely and happily. 

Please let us know if you think this would suit you and your situation. If it isn’t we may be able to place them in our foster program, so please let us know.

Thanks,
Homeless Hounds Animal Rescue

-----
Please do not reply to this email as it will be sent to an unmonitored mailbox.

To contact us, please visit our website by visiting: https://homelesshounds.com.au/contact-us

www.homelesshounds.com.au

1.name: Default Confirmation
1.message:
Hi there,

Thanks for submitting this Surrender form for your pet. A member of our volunteer team will be in touch with you in 1-2 business days, or ASAP.

We understand surrendering a pet isn’t easy and we seek to make the process as easy as possible for you and your dog and will help you if we can.

Unfortunately, rescue is incredibly busy, we are seeing an unprecedented number of dogs and cats in need, coupled with fewer available volunteers and opportunities to fundraise. 

We do want to help you responsibly rehome your animal though and have a good option for you to consider:

Foster to surrender program - this is where you keep your pet and we work together to find them the life and people that suit them. We assess their needs in a home, and we meet them and assess the dog's specific needs, likes and dislikes and training considerations. We then advertise them, screen potential adopters and work with you to select the best situation and humans for your dog and then support the adopters to settle the dog in successfully and address any training or medical needs it may have. We charge an adoption fee to the new adopters to cover these costs, so there is no charge to you, (however we will happily accept donations!).

This is a great option for surrendering owners and dogs. The dogs avoid the extra stress of a move and the owner gets to be a part of the selection process in picking a new home. 

This is often the fastest and most successful way to get your dog rehomed safely and happily. 

Please let me know if you think this would suit you and your situation. If it isn’t we may be able to place them in our foster program, so please let us know.

Kind regards,
Homeless Hounds Animal Rescue

60.label: Are you looking for a specifically advertised cat OR any suitable cat?
60.description: We have many unadvertised cats and dogs - some may be suitable.

11.label: Name of the Cat you're applying for

4.label: Your Details
4.description: Please answer all questions below about your details

12.label: Questions about your Lifestyle
12.description:
The questions below are designed to help Homeless Hounds match you with the right
cat. Please answer as many questions as you can, accurately and with sufficient detail.

73.label: 1. Please tell us more about yourself, your lifestyle and your household? What will the average day for your cat look like?

55.label: 2. Do have children under 15 that will live with or have regular contact with the cat?

56.label: 2.1 If "yes", what are the ages of children (under 15) that will live with or have regular contact with the cat?

57.label: 2.2 If "yes", have the above mentioned children lived with or had regular contact with cats before?

70.label: 3. Do you currently or have you previously owned a cat, dog or other animals?

71.label: 3.1 If yes, please give details - e.g. number, breed, sex, age and whether or not they’re still in your care.

72.label: 3.1 If no, have you previously owned any cats or other animals? Please give details.

54.label: 4. Will the cat have regular contact with elderly people, dogs or livestock? Please specify.

21.label: 4.1 If "dogs" or "livestock", please elaborate e.g. type, breed, age, gender, desexed, parasite control, vaccinations etc. Are they social with other animals?

19.label: 4.2 If you have a dog, has it lived with a cat before? If not, has it met a cat and what was its reaction?

52.label: 5. Will your cat be an:

3.label: Both (access via cat door, open door etc.)

52.description: Homeless Hounds does not adopt cats to homes where they will be kept entirely outside.

15.label: 5.1 If "both", please elaborate e.g. using a cat door, being let in and out etc.

58.label: 6. Do you have any experience with fostering animals?

36.label: 7. Do you have a cat door or cat enclosure? (please select most appropriate)

23.label: 8. If you adopt this cat, how soon can you pick him/her up?

61.label: 9. To the best of your knowledge, is anyone in your house allergic to cats?

62.label: 9.1 If "yes", please elaborate e.g. which family members, what sorts of allergies etc.

65.label: 10. If you’re renting, do you have your Landlord’s approval to have a pet?

66.label: 11. Do you agree to return the cat to Homeless Hounds should your circumstances change or the cat not settle in as hoped?

68.label: 12. Would you be interested in fostering with a view to adoption possibly suitable cats?

67.label: 13. If this cat isn't suitable, would you like us to suggest other options?

74.label: 14. Are you an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident?

3.label: Confirmation
3.description:
By submitting this form, you declare that all details are accurate to the best of your knowledge.

Upon review and approval, Homeless Hounds will contact you as soon as possible. We reserve the right to refuse any applicant.

We will require the successful applicant to sign an adoption agreement, provide pictures of the yard as you have described above and allowed for a yard check before adoption.

We appreciate you taking the time to complete this application.

3.notification_name: Cat - Adoption Application (User - Any Suitable Cat)
3.subject: Thanks for applying to adopt a cat!
3.message:
Hi {field_id="7"},

Thanks for applying to adopt a suitable cat!

Homeless Hounds is staffed by volunteers and we are very busy rescuing and rehoming animals, so please be patient with us. 

However please know, your contact is important to us, and we will aim to respond to your email as soon as a suitable cat is available. 

In the meantime, please keep an eye on our website - https://homelesshounds.com.au/adopt/

Sincerely,

The Homeless Hounds Team
-----
Please do not reply to this email as it will be sent to an unmonitored mailbox.

To contact us, please visit our website by visiting: https://homelesshounds.com.au/contact-us

www.homelesshounds.com.au

Thanks for applying to adopt {field_id="11"}! 

Homeless Hounds is staffed by volunteers and we are very busy rescuing and rehoming animals, so please be patient with us. 

However please know, your contact is important to us, and we will aim to respond to your email 4-5 business days. 

If you are wanting to follow up on an application, please expect to hear from us within 2 weeks with next steps or to be notified an animal has been adopted.

Sincerely,

The Homeless Hounds Team
-----
Please do not reply to this email as it will be sent to an unmonitored mailbox.

www.homelesshounds.com.au

12.description:

dog. Please answer as many questions as you can, accurately and with sufficient detail.

67.label: 1. Please tell us more about yourself, your lifestyle and your household? What will the average day for your dog look like?

69.label: 5.1 If "outside" or "both" please elaborate e.g. is there a dry place for the dog to sleep outside, access to food/water, size of the yard etc. (copy)

60.label: 6. Will the dog be without human company for periods of the day?

20.label: 6.1. If "yes", how many hours will the dog be without human company for each day?

44.label: 7. Do you currently have any pets?

45.label: 7.1  If so, what kind? Breed, age, gender, desexed? Up to date with parasite control and vaccinations? Are they social with other animals? If not please specify.

46.label: 9. Do you have any experience with fostering animals?

26.label: 13. Please tell us what may put you off certain dogs, i.e. are there any breeds you would not consider?

50.label: 16.1 Please describe it, including size, and describe the type of fencing (wooden, colorbond, wire etc.) and height at the lowest point. If you don't have an area where a dog can be safely contained please let us know where they will toilet?

30.label: 17. If you live on acreage, how will you restrain the dog when you are away?

51.label: 18. Do you have a swimming pool?

52.label: 18.1 If "yes", is your pool securely fenced?
52.description: If "no", your yard will need to be inspected before any adoption is approved.

59.label: 19. How do you plan to train your new dog? Will you take your new dog to obedience school or do you plan to train it yourself?

33.label: 19.1 If you plan to train yourself please explain what methods you will use.

58.label: 20. Are you looking for a dog that will be happy visiting dog parks and being around other dogs?
58.description: Please be aware that many dogs, like people, aren’t social butterflies and aren't comfortable with busy dog park environments.

34.label: 20.1 If "no", please explain how you plan to socialise your dog.
34.description: Please be aware that many dogs, like people, aren’t social butterflies and aren't comfortable with busy dog park environments.

53.label: 21. If this dog isn't suitable, would you like us to suggest other options?

62.label: 22. Would you be interested in fostering with a view to adoption possibly suitable dogs?

65.label: 23.1. If you are renting, do you have landlord permission to have a dog?

66.label: 24. Are you an Australian Citizen or Permanent Resident?

2.message:
Hi {field_id="7"},

Thanks for applying to adopt {field_id="11"}! 

Homeless Hounds is staffed by volunteers and we are very busy rescuing and rehoming animals, so please be patient with us. 

However please know, your contact is important to us, and we will aim to respond to your email in 4-5 business days. 

If you are wanting to follow up on an application, please expect to hear from us within 2 weeks with next steps or to be notified an animal has been adopted.

Sincerely,

The Homeless Hounds Team
-----
Please do not reply to this email as it will be sent to an unmonitored mailbox.

www.homelesshounds.com.au

1.name: Default Confirmation
1.message:
Thanks for applying to adopt a rescue dog! A member of our adoptions team will be in touch with you in 4-5 business days, or ASAP.

To learn more about what it means to adopt a rescue dog, click here.

Hi {field_id="0"},

Thanks for your enquiry. We've received your enquiry and one of our volunteers will be in touch in the coming days.

Sincerely,

The Homeless Hounds Team
